topic.title: Customizing the Content Completion Assistant for Text Mode

keywords.indexterm: Customizing the Content Completion Assistant Text mode

body.p: gathers information from the associated schemas (DTDs, XML Schema, RelaxNG) to determine the proposals that appear in the Content Completion Assistant. also includes support that allows you to customize the Content Completion Assistant to suit your specific needs.

You can add, modify, or remove actions that are proposed for each particular document type (framework) by using the Content Completion subtab in the Document Type Association configuration dialog box. To access this subtab, , go to Document Type Association, use the New, Edit, Duplicate, or Extend button, click on the Author tab, and then the Content Completion subtab.

More advanced customization can be done by using a configuration file that is specific to each document type (framework). You can use this configuration file to configure the values that are proposed in certain contexts, or to customize the attributes or elements that are proposed.
